Package model.business

Class EmployeeProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.business.EmployeeProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EmployeeEdit, EmployeeRead, EmployeeWrite
    public class EmployeeProxy
extends java.lang.Object
implements EmployeeEdit
    responsible for managing a readers-writers lock pattern on an Employee instance

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      (package private) void addToQueue()
      adds a session to the queue
      IMPORTANT: dependent on ModelManager's getCurrentSessionID() to get the session ID
      IMPORTANT: dependent on ModelManager's employeeAcquired() to notify the caller session if its already first in the queue
      int getDepartment()
      delegates the request to the real subject, since reading does not need a lock
      int getID()
      delegates the request to the real subject, since reading does not need a lock
      java.lang.String getName()
      delegates the request to the real subject, since reading does not need a lock
      boolean isAcquired()
      returns true if the Caller ClientHandler Thread is first in the queue meaning it has the lock and write privilege
      IMPORTANT: dependent on ModelManager's getCurrentSessionID()
      boolean isAdmin()
      delegates the request to the real subject, since reading does not need a lock
      boolean isArchived()
      delegates the request to the real subject, since reading does not need a lock
      boolean isPassword​(java.lang.String password)
      delegates the request to the real subject, since reading does not need a lock
      (package private) void removeFromQueue()
      removes a session from the queue
      IMPORTANT: dependent on ModelManager's getCurrentSessionID()
      IMPORTANT: dependent on ModelManager's employeeAcquired() to notify the next session of the queue if the first one gets removed

      checks if the Caller ClientHandler Thread is first in the queue, and if yes, it delegates the request to the real subject
